Positive: Bartholin cyst typically causes a lump or swelling near the opening of the vagina. Other symptoms may include pain or discomfort during intercourse, walking, or sitting. The cyst may also become infected, leading to symptoms such as redness, tenderness, fever, or a feeling of fullness in the vulva.
Negative: A normal person without Bartholin cyst would not experience any lumps, swelling, or pain near the opening of the vagina. They would not have discomfort during activities like intercourse, walking, or sitting. There would be no signs of infection such as redness, tenderness, fever, or a feeling of fullness in the vulva.
